subelement_relations.Description: Solar-powered irrigation systems are a sub-component of energy for smallholder farmers. These systems use solar energy to power water pumps, allowing farmers to efficiently irrigate their crops and increase agricultural productivity.

Biogas digesters are a type of energy technology used by smallholder farmers. These digesters convert organic waste into biogas, which can be used for cooking, heating, and generating electricity, providing a sustainable energy solution for farmers.

Energy-efficient cooking stoves are a sub-component of energy for smallholder farmers. These stoves are designed to minimize fuel consumption and reduce indoor air pollution, improving the cooking conditions for farmers and their families.

Off-grid solar systems are a type of energy solution for smallholder farmers. These systems provide electricity to remote areas without access to the grid, enabling farmers to power their agricultural activities and improve their livelihoods.

Micro-hydro power systems are a type of renewable energy technology used by smallholder farmers. These systems harness the power of flowing water to generate electricity, providing a reliable and sustainable energy source for farmers.
